|wi1_chip2_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip2_model=BCM2050 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=yes |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;SiGe;SE2525L;SiGe, 2525L, 4128L;1; |flags= |stock_boot=CFE; |stock_os=Linux; |tp_firmware=DD-WRT, Tomato, OpenWrt, TomatoUSB |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=001601XXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^001601[A-F0-9]{6}$ |default_ip=192.168.11.1 |default_user=root |default_pass=''blank'' |oui=00:16:01 |oui_eth=00:16:01 }} OEM Gemtek WRTB-133G (WRTB-133G_V00) / WRTB-134G (WRTB-134G_V01A) / WRTB-153G (WRTB-153G_V01) The default IP for the router is 192.168.11.1 operating as an AP and 192.168.11.100 operating as a bridge. The power adapter included with the device is a '''Buffalo''' US112-3320 (3.3V, 2A). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate. ==Additional external links== *[http://www.ibmmuseum.com/ohlandl/NIC/whr-g54s.html On '''ibmmuseum.com'''] *{{TechInfoDepot|Buffalo_WHR-G54S}} *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/buffalo/whr-g54s On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] ==Images== File:Buffalo WHR-G54S board top.jpg|board top File:Buffalo WHR-G54S board top heatsink removed.jpg|board top, heatsink off File:Buffalo WHR-G54S board bot.jpg|board bottom [[Has images::internal| ]] ==Additional information== ===wl revinfo===
